Gastown/Ralph Integration: Ephemeral Workers for Iterative Development
description:
Implement Gastown-style multi-agent orchestration in Speckle, enabling iterative development with ephemeral workers. Based on Steve Yegge's Gastown (8.8k⭐) and Geoffrey Huntley's Ralph pattern (9.8k⭐).

## Key Features
- /speckle.loop: Ralph-style iterative execution until all tasks pass
- DoD Verifiers: Enforce completion criteria before closing tasks
- Progress persistence: Learnings survive session restarts
- Convoy system: Bundle related tasks for assignment
- Ephemeral workers: Git worktree isolation for parallel agents

## Phases
1. Ralph Loop (/speckle.loop) - P1
2. DoD Verifiers - P1
3. Convoy System - P2
4. Ephemeral Workers - P2
5. Mayor Mode - P3

See: https://github.com/JulianDouma/Speckle/issues/18

title: Create Speckle self-optimization agent that uses Speckle to improve Speckle
description:
## Vision

Create a specialized AI agent workflow that uses Speckle's own tooling to continuously improve Speckle itself. This embodies the self-hosting philosophy already mentioned in the README.

## Academic Justification

- **Agentless** (arXiv:2407.01489): Simple 3-phase pipelines are proven effective
- **SWE-agent ACI** (arXiv:2405.15793): Well-designed interfaces enable autonomous improvement
- **daVinci-Agency** (arXiv:2602.02619): Training on PR sequences yields broad improvements

## Proposed Workflow

1. `/speckle.analyze-self` - Run analysis on Speckle's own commands
2. `/speckle.benchmark` - Measure command reliability/success rates
3. `/speckle.improve` - Generate improvements based on findings
4. `/speckle.validate` - Validate changes don't break existing functionality

## Benefits

- Dogfooding ensures high quality
- Continuous improvement loop
- Real-world validation of Speckle patterns
- Builds confidence through self-application

## Implementation Notes

- Start with read-only analysis (safe)
- Add improvement suggestions as second phase
- Human approval gate before applying changes
- Track metrics over time to measure improvement
